name: efcore-migration-script-generator-task
friendlyName: Entity Framework Core Migrations Script Generator
description: Tool for projects that use Entity Framework Core Code-First. Generates migration scripts which can be used to update a database (for instance with the task 'Azure SQL Database Deployment').
author: PEK's Productions

inputs.name: projectpath
inputs.label: Main Project Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to project (for instance a .csproj file) containing DbContexts.

inputs.name: databasecontexts
inputs.label: DbContexts
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name(s) of DbContexts, one per line.

inputs.name: startupprojectpath
inputs.label: Startup Project Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to an executable project that references the Main Project containing your DbContext(s) (for instance a .csproj file). If the DbContext(s) are defined in the Main Project, then this setting is not necessary.

inputs.name: targetfolder
inputs.label: Target Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Where migration scripts should be saved. One .sql file will be generated for each DbContext you specify, named the same as your DbContext class. For example, if your DbContext is named MyTestDbContext, then the output file will be named MyTestDbContext.sql.

inputs.name: installdependencies
inputs.label: Install dependencies for .NET Core 3
inputs.helpMarkDown: If you are using **.NET Core 3**, the global tool **dotnet-ef** needs be installed before migrations script could be generated. Check this setting to do this automatically.

inputs.name: eftoolversion
inputs.label: Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Version of **dotnet-ef** to be installed. Example **3.1.1**. Leave empty for latest version.
